lead_paragraph: A former I.R.S. official details the Obama administration’s justification for spending that is at the heart of a federal lawsuit by House Republicans.

headline.print_headline: Health Care Doubts in Secret Meeting
headline.main: In a Secret Meeting, Revelations on the Battle Over Health Care

snippet: A former I.R.S. official details the Obama administration’s justification for spending that is at the heart of a federal lawsuit by House Republicans.
abstract: Carl Hulse On Washington column discusses deposition from former IRS official detailing Obama administration's justification for spending $3.9 billion on consumer health insurance subsidies in 2013 for Affordable Care Act; spending is subject of federal lawsuit by House Republicans.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
